channel.title: How do I update the "Run" Batch file to my new JDK?
channel.description:
Heres my Jdk Version:
[code]1.7.0_03[/code]
Heres the outdated Batch code to start the client:
[code]@echo off @title Running Server java -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -server -Xms2048m -Xmx4096m -cp
bin;data/libs/netty-3.5.2.Final.jar;data/libs/FileStore.jar
com.rs.Launcher false false true pause[/code]
If anyone can help me that would be great!

item.title: How do I update the "Run" Batch file to my new JDK?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

That is perfectly fine, just update your PATH to include the new JDK home.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I update the "Run" Batch file to my new JDK?

item.title: How do I update the "Run" Batch file to my new JDK?
item.dc:creator: @NameGuy NameGuy
item.description:
@NameGuy wrote:

Heres my Jdk Version:

Heres the outdated Batch code to start the client:

[code]@echo off
@title Running Server
java -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -server -Xms2048m -Xmx4096m -cp

bin;data/libs/netty-3.5.2.Final.jar;data/libs/FileStore.jar

com.rs.Launcher false false true
pause[/code]

If anyone can help me that would be great!
